intro: Diplopterys leiocarpa, commonly known as the Amazonian moonflower, is a climbing shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fruits that are capsule-like in structure. It is often found in humid, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental qualities. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
